article.name: SonicWall Capture Client Integration Guide for SecurityCoach
article.title: SonicWall Capture Client Integration Guide for SecurityCoach
article.body:
In this article, you will learn how to integrate SonicWall Capture Client with SecurityCoach. Once you set up this integration, data provided by SonicWall will be available under the SecurityCoach tab of your KSAT console. This data can be viewed in SecurityCoach reports and used to create detection rules for real-time coaching campaigns.

For general information about SecurityCoach, see our SecurityCoach Product Manual.

Create a SonicWall Capture Client Admin Account

Before you can set up the integration in your KSAT console, you will need to create a SonicWall Capture Client admin account. To create your admin account, follow the steps below:

Note:If your organization already has a SonicWall Capture Client admin account, you can skip the steps in this section and follow the steps in the Obtain Your SentinelOne API Key section of this article.
  1. From your browser, navigate to your SonicWall Capture Client console and click Login with MySonicWall.
  2. Navigate to Management > Administrators.
  3. Click the + sign on the right to open the Administrators window.
  4. Enter the desired email, name, and password for your new admin account.
  5. Click Create.

Obtain Your SentinelOne API Key

Before you set up the integration in your KSAT console, you will need to obtain your SentinelOne API key. To obtain your API key, create a support ticket from your SonicWall console requesting your SentinelOne API key from the SonicWall support team.

Set Up the Integration in Your KSAT Console

Once you've created your SonicWall Capture Client admin account and obtained your SentinelOne API key, you can set up the integration in your KSAT console. To set up the integration in your KSAT console, follow the steps below:

  1. Log in to your KSAT console and navigate to SecurityCoach > Setup.
  2. In the Available Integrations section, locate the SonicWall Capture Client card.
  3. At the bottom of the card, click Configure.
  4. In the User Name field, enter the email address from the admin account you created in the Create a SonicWall Capture Client Admin Account section of this article.
  5. In the Password field, enter the password from the admin account you created in the Create a SonicWall Capture Client Admin Account section of this article.
  6. In the URL field, enter your SonicWall Capture Client console URL. Your SonicWall Capture Client console URL will be similar to “https://captureclient-01.sonicwall.com”.
  7. In the API Key field, enter your SentinelOne API key.
  8. Click Authorize.

Map Your Users

After you’ve finished integrating SonicWall Capture Client, you can map your users either through mapping rules (recommended) or through a CSV file upload. For more information about user mapping, see our Mapping Users in SecurityCoach article.

Once you’ve successfully authorized this integration, you can manage detection rules for SonicWall Capture Client on the Detection Rules subtab of SecurityCoach. For a full list of available system detection rules for this vendor, see our Which Detection Rules Can I Use with My Vendors? article.

images.alt:
This image displays the login interface for the **SonicWall Capture Client Management** portal, accessed via the URL `captureclient-36.sonicwall.com/login`.

**Context and Branding:**
The interface features a dark gray background. The top section is branded with the white and orange **SONICWALL** logo, followed by the product title: **Capture Client Management**.

**Login Elements (Email Flow):**
The primary login form is introduced by the heading "Sign in to your account."
1.  **Field Label:** Email
2.  **Input Field:** Placeholder text reads: "your email address..."
3.  **Primary Action Button:** An orange rectangular button labeled **NEXT** is positioned beneath the input field, indicating a multi-step login process.

**Alternative Actions:**
Two hyperlinked options are available below the primary action button:
1.  **Forgot password?** (Standard hyperlink)
2.  **Login with MySonicWall** (Highlighted with an orange border, signifying an alternative authentication method).
images.context: sole and click Login with MySonicWall.

images.alt:
This image displays the vertical navigation pane (sidebar) of the SONICWALL security management interface.

**UI Description and Context:**

The navigation pane uses a dark gray background with white/light gray text and amber/orange iconography. The branding, "SONICWALL," is prominently displayed at the top.

**Primary Navigation Elements (Top-Level Menu Items):**

The menu is structured hierarchically. All top-level items are listed with unique amber icons:

1.  Dashboard
2.  Threats
3.  Applications
4.  Activities & Logs
5.  Web Activity
6.  Assets
7.  Policies

**Active and Expanded Section:**

The **Management** primary menu item is highlighted using a darker gray background, indicating it is the currently expanded section. It is accompanied by an amber gear icon overlaying a stylized person icon.

**Secondary Navigation Elements (Sub-Menu Items):**

The three sub-menu items under **Management** are indented and prefixed with a simple dash:

*   **Administrators:** This item is specifically marked as the current selection by an amber/orange circular indicator dot located on the far right edge of the navigation bar.
*   Tenant Settings
*   Client Installers

**Final Element:**

The list concludes with the **Reports** primary menu item, featuring an amber icon depicting a magnifying glass over a chart.

This image depicts the top section of a web-based administration screen, structured into a header and an action bar.

**Context and Navigation:**
1.  **Page Title:** The primary heading is large and dark gray: **"Administrators"**.
2.  **Breadcrumb Navigation:** Located below the title, a navigation path is presented in smaller, lighter gray text, preceded by a home icon: `[Home Icon] / MANAGEMENT / ADMINISTRATORS`.
3.  **Separator:** A thin, horizontal orange line separates the main header area from the content control bar.

**Action and Control Bar:**
The bar below the separator contains several icon-based controls, typically associated with list management:
*   **Search and Filter Controls (Left):**
    *   A funnel/down-arrow icon (indicates filtering functionality).
    *   A magnifying glass icon (indicates search functionality).
*   **Primary Action Controls (Right):**
    *   **Add Button:** A square button highlighted with a thick orange border, containing a white plus sign (**+**). This is positioned as the primary action (e.g., "Add New Administrator").
    *   **Export/Share Icon:** A box with an outward-pointing arrow (suggesting export or share functionality).
    *   **Refresh Icon:** A circular arrow icon (indicates list refresh or reload functionality).
images.context: sign on the right to open the Administrators window.

images.alt:
This image displays the SonicWall Capture Client Management interface, specifically the "Administrators" section, with a modal dialog overlay for creating a new user.

**Overall Context and Navigation:**
*   **Header:** Shows "Capture Client Management" and a product identifier drop-down ("SecurityAdvisor Products-CC000002A96B"). User notifications and profile icons (bell and 'AB') are visible on the far right.
*   **Navigation Panel (Left Sidebar):** Standard navigation items are listed. The "Management" section is highlighted (indicated by a gear icon and orange marker), and the sub-menu "Administrators" is actively selected. Other management sub-menus include "Tenant Settings" and "Client Installers."
*   **Main Content Area:** The page title is "Administrators," with a breadcrumb trail: " / MANAGEMENT / ADMINISTRATORS." Underlying list data is partially visible, showing columns like "LAST LOGGED IN" and date/time entries.

**Modal Dialog - "CREATE USER":**
A prominent, centrally located modal dialog is overlaid, titled **"CREATE USER."** This dialog contains the following form fields, displayed vertically with their labels left-aligned and input fields right-aligned:

1.  **Email:** Input field populated with `test@mail.com`.
2.  **Name:** Input field populated with `test`.
3.  **Role:** Drop-down menu, currently set to `Admin`.
4.  **Inactivity Logout:** Empty input field, accompanied by a small gray question mark icon (indicating a help or information tooltip).
5.  **Password:** Password input field (masked with asterisks: `********`).
6.  **Confirm Password:** Password input field (masked with asterisks: `********`). This field has an orange border, often signifying focus or a required input state. It is also accompanied by a gray question mark icon.

**Action Buttons (Within Modal):**
The bottom right of the modal contains two action buttons:
*   **Cancel** (Gray/White button)
*   **Create** (Orange, primary action button)

**Footer:**
The application footer is visible at the bottom left, displaying: "© Copyright 2021 SonicWall. All Rights Reserved."
images.context:
for your new admin account.
Click Create.

images.alt: The image displays a user interface pane, characterized by a white background and minimalist design, likely representing a device initialization or setup screen. Branding is featured prominently in the upper center, consisting of the gray text "SONICWALL" paired with its distinctive orange logo accent mark. The primary UI element is a large, rectangular blue action button located at the bottom center. This button contains the white, centered text label: **Configure**.
images.context: At the bottom of the card, click Configure.

images.alt:
This image displays a configuration screen for the **SonicWall Capture Client** integration interface.

**Header and Navigation:**
*   The page title is **SonicWall Capture Client**.
*   A navigation link in the upper right corner reads **← Back to Integrations**.

**Instructional Banner:**
*   A light blue informational banner spans the width of the main content area.
*   The text within the banner states: "For more information about configuring this vendor integration, click **Configuration Help**."
*   A dedicated button, labeled **Configuration Help**, is located on the right side of the banner.

**Required Input Fields (Integration Credentials):**
The primary section features four mandatory input fields organized into two columns for vendor authentication and connection details:

*   **User Name** (Input field)
*   **Password** (Input field)
*   **URL** (Input field)
*   **SentinelOne API Key** (Input field)

**Action Controls:**
Two action buttons are positioned at the bottom of the form:

*   **Reset** (Secondary button)
*   **Authorize** (Primary button, highlighted in blue)

The image displays the **SonicWall Capture Client User Mapping** configuration interface, designed for linking endpoint identifiers to internal user profiles (KMSAT/Knowbe4).

**Interface Structure and Context:**
*   **Title:** SonicWall Capture Client User Mapping.
*   **Instructional Text:** Explains that mapping can be achieved via configuring rules or uploading a CSV file, and provides a reference link to the "Mapping Users in SecurityCoach article."
*   **Navigation Tabs:** Two tabs define the configuration method:
    1.  **Mapping Rules (Recommended)** (Active tab)
    2.  **CSV File Upload** (Inactive tab)

**Active Configuration Section (Mapping Rules):**
*   **Header:** Configure Mapping Rules.
*   **Purpose:** Describes the function of mapping users to "KMSAT user data fields."
*   **Rule Configuration:** A single, partially configured rule is displayed:
    *   **Source Data:** SonicWall Capture Client **Hostname**
    *   **Condition:** is
    *   **Target Data (Input):** A dropdown labeled **Knowbe4 User Data Field** currently displaying "Select option."
    *   **Action Button:** Add Field (adjacent to the target data dropdown).
*   **Rule Management:** A link to "Add Another Rule" is present below the default rule configuration.

**Action Buttons (Footer):**
*   **Primary Action:** Save (blue, solid button).
*   **Destructive Action:** Delete Integration (red border, white background button).
